member.param: An MdxInitialSettings instance containing the initial settings for the data source, or null.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Olap.Mdx.MdxDataSource.GetCatalogsAsync(System.Windows.Forms.Control)
member.summary: Sends an asynchronous request to the OLAP server to return a list of all catalogs associated with this data source.
member.param: Optional reference to a Control. If specified, the GetCatalogsAsyncCompleted event is raised on the thread on which this control's handle was created. This approach makes it possible to access control members directly from the event handler.

remarks.p: This method returns immediately after issuing the request to the OLAP server so as not to block the calling thread. The actual operation, however, does not occur until the server returns this request, which happens indeterminately.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Olap.Mdx.MdxDataSource.SetCatalogAsync(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Windows.Forms.Control)
member.summary: Sends an asynchronous request to the OLAP server to set the specified catalog as the data source's current catalog.
member.param: The name of the catalog to which the data source's current catalog is to be set.

param.name: update
param.p: Optional boolean value indicating whether to update the data source immediately.
The default value is true, which causes the request to be sent to the OLAP server immediately, and raises the SetCatalogAsyncCompleted event when the server's response has been received.
If false is specified, the request is not sent to the server until the UpdateAsync method is called.
Note that when false is specified, the SetCatalogAsyncCompleted event does not occur.

member.param: Optional reference to a Control. If specified, the SetCatalogAsyncCompleted event is raised on the thread on which this control's handle was created. This approach makes it possible to access control members directly from the event handler.

remarks.p: A catalog is synonymous to a database; it defines the set of cubes that are available to the consumer.

Changing the data source's currently selected catalog triggers re-initialization of the data source.Any previously defined cubes, as well as their associated hierarchies and measures, are no longer valid, so any cached information that references hierarchies, measures, or cubes defined by the previously selected catalog should be refreshed after calling this method.

This method returns immediately after issuing the request to the OLAP server so as not to block the calling thread. The actual operation, however, does not occur until the server returns this request, which happens indeterminately.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Olap.Mdx.MdxDataSource.Catalog
member.summary: Returns the currently selected Catalog, or null if no catalog is selected.

remarks.p: The current catalog can be changed by calling the SetCatalogAsync method.
Setting the current catalog is an asynchronous operation; as such this property will not return a valid value until the SetCatalogAsyncCompleted event has occurred.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Olap.Mdx.MdxDataSource.IsAsyncOperationPending
member.summary: Returns boolean value indicating whether the data source is currently processing an asynchronous method call.

remarks.p: This property returns true when an asynchronous method has been called, and the OLAP server has not yet sent a response indicating that the operation is complete.
